thread.title: ASU vs. UCLA: What to watch for
thread.title_full: ASU vs. UCLA: What to watch for

title: ASU vs. UCLA: What to watch for
text:
ASU vs. UCLA: What to watch for Can ASU rebound from last week's blowout loss? Post to Facebook ASU vs. UCLA: What to watch for Can ASU rebound from last week's blowout loss?   12news.com: http://12ne.ws/1Rkw6jo   Join the Conversation To   ASU vs. UCLA: What to watch for Robby Baker , 12 Sports 9:30 a.m. MST October 2, 2015 Can ASU rebound from last week's blowout loss? Sep 26, 2015; Tempe, AZ, USA; Arizona State Sun Devils quarterback Mike Bercovici (bottom) is tackled by Southern California Trojans linebacker Scott Felix (47) and defensive end Greg Townsend Jr. (93) in the second half at Sun Devil Stadium. The Trojans defeated the Sun Devils 42-14. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports) 
Rebounding 
How does a team respond to an embarrassing loss? 
Well I guess we'll find out Saturday, when the Arizona State Sun Devils take on the UCLA Bruins. 
"We're excited to see how we can respond Saturday on the field," said quarterback Mike Bercovici on Thursday. 
Head coach Todd Graham said Tuesday was "the best practice we've had all year." 
So will this lead to a major Pac-12 victory for ASU? 
We'll have to wait and see, but these are the type of games that define a program. 
After the sluggish start to the season, the Sun Devils are in desperate need of a win, and to establish an identity. 
Roller-coaster series 
This series has been a back-and-forth slugfest over the past couple years. 
Last season, the Bruins came into Tempe and crushed the Sun Devils, winning 62-27. Two years ago, ASU beat UCLA in LA 38-33. 
Three years ago, it was the Bruins getting the better of ASU. 
You see where I'm going with this. 
History says this is ASU's year for a victory, but based on how these two teams have looked, it seems ASU is in for a huge, uphill climb. ASU Football feels it has responded this week KPNX 
Do or die 
This is the Sun Devils season. 
Yes, they'll still play games regardless of what happens on Saturday night. 
If ASU lays an egg like they did against USC though, you can stick a fork in them, they're done. 
Sure, Sun Devil fans would love a victory this Saturday, but what they really want is to see just a glimpse of what Graham said was the best team he's ever coached. 
ASU just needs to put together a good game. 
Based on what the Sun Devils have done so far, it's unlikely they beat UCLA. If they can string together four quarters and keep it close however, there will be some reason for hope. 
If they get their doors blown off again, ASU fans will have to keep their fingers crossed for a bid to the Las Vegas Bowl. Read or Share this story: http://12ne.ws/1Rkw6jo TOP VIDEOS
